entry.title: Adjust snapped window bounds on workspace event
entry.content:
This CL fixes the snapped window bounds in response to workspace events.

When any workspace event happens, the snapped window bounds need to be

adjusted, but it should keep the snap ratio instead of resetting it to

the *default* snapped bounds.



Example: Letâ€™s say the workarea width is 1200dp. After resizing a

snapped window width to be like 600dp->300dp, the snap ratio is 0.25

(=300/1200). When the workarea width is changed to 800dp, the window

width should be updated to 200dp (=800*0.25) because we need to keep the

snap ratio 0.25.



TEST=ClientControlledStateTestClamshellAndTablet.ResizeSnappedWindow

BUG=b:235312364

BUG=b:207597527

BUG=b:178766080

BUG=b:280225357



Change-Id: Id0f1d31734932f84b340b44f7e070824fab6a7f0

Reviewed-by: Xiaoqian Dai

entry.title: Web Apps: Track media usage using MediaStreamCaptureIndicator::Observer
entry.content:
Media usage (camera & microphone access) is currently tracked using

MediaCaptureDevicesDispatcher. This has a couple of edge-cases where we

aren't able to track usage correctly. Instead, other similar use-cases

listen to MediaStreamCaptureIndicator, which powers the per-tab "using

media" icons. This has a simpler API which also takes care of more cases

automatically (e.g. WebContents being destroyed).



To make this work, we add some new APIs to MediaRequests, which is used

to track which WebContents are using media. Once we migrate other

publishers onto MediaStreamCaptureIndicator (in a follow-up), we can

fully remove the previous code for tracking media requests.



Bug: 1455316, b/270212284

Change-Id: Iac9678762bbbfcf9452e15c0fe139be187977562

entry.title: snap-group: Enter and exit overview basic
entry.content:
This CL implements a basic version to enter and exit overview for

windows in snap group.

Enter:

1. Adding a boolean to determine whether it is in a snap group

creation session, which will be used to determine whether to enter

full or partial overview;

2. Split view will end upon entering full overview.

Exit:

1. `SnapGroupController` will implement `OverviewObserver`;

2. Windows that are in snap group need to be restored and snapped

properly on overview ended;

3. Overview session will not open when restoring the snapped

window state for windows that are in snap group. This is

achieved by setting `can_enter_overview_` to false temporarily.



Fixed: b/286453359

Demo: http://b/286453359#comment3

Test: Added unit test + manual

Change-Id: I680e7d1c5d5441c55fd87bc4bd03dc3b35f43433

entry.title: Omnibox: make OmniboxSuggestionUsedMetricsObserver align with UMAPLMO
entry.content:
I6a6c1566d94554b6fe2e0ec6cc6fab9e17ea795c added this metric for LCP,

but its behavior is a little different from

UmaPageLoadMetricsObserver(UMAPLMO).



UMAPLMOï¼Œ which is well-defined and used for CWV,

defines a different strategy of collecting LCP timing from

OmniboxSuggestionUsedMetricsObserver.

Specifically, when a page enters background:

- UmaPageLoadMetricsObserver uses CONTINUE_OBSERVING

- OmniboxSuggestionUsedMetricsObserver uses STOP_OBSERVING.



This may make the comparison among different LCP metrics difficult.



This CL tweaks the OmniboxSuggestionUsedMetricsObserver's logic to

make it align with UmaPageLoadMetricsObserver.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint2]=replaced by Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint2.1 for changing the logging logic. The difference is whether to record LCP after the OnHidden event.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.URL.NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint2]=replaced by Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.URL.NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint2.1 for changing the logging logic. The difference is whether to record LCP after the OnHidden event.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint2Above2s]=replaced by Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint2.1Above2s for changing the logging logic. The difference is whether to record LCP after the OnHidden event.



Bug: 1453559

Change-Id: Ibf44b2c222b51c93871108b4d3eb7fcb60f825f2

entry.title: Simplify scale factor logic for Lacros
entry.content:
Currently, the display scale factor logic applies scaling

transform to the host window, which causes the submitted

CompositorFrame to be scaled up and then down again.



This change applies display scale factor transform to the

root surface, instead of the host window.



TEST=Connect an external monitor.

- Set different scale factors between the two monitors.

- Open Lacros, move it between the two monitors.

- Verify that rounded corners, shadows and UI elements

are properly sized, scaled and clipped.

- Also, open ARC apps and verify those are properly scaled too.

- ARC notifications are also scared correctly in both monitors.



BUG=1450006



Change-Id: I06eea22a542ec6f313f1961433221ef3e6614c92

entry.title: WebApp: Move shortcuts menu downloaded icon sizes into item info struct
entry.content:
Previously WebApp had two separate fields:

vector shortcuts_menu_item_infos_;

vector downloaded_shortcuts_menu_icons_sizes_;

These were required to be the same length as they together recorded

information about the same thing (each index corresponds to an entry in

the shortcuts menu). This was both unergonomic and error-prone (see

attached bug).



This CL adds an IconSizes field to the WebAppShortcutsMenuItemInfo

struct so that there is always exactly 1 IconSizes per ItemInfo.



No functional changes.



Bug: 1427444

entry.title: Refactor paint logic in TabStyleViews to use TabSelectionState enum.
entry.content:
- Replace TabActive with TabSelectionState. TabSelectionState is broader than TabActive, covering hover and selected states, so passing it around instead of TabActive allows us to simplify some of the maze of methods for painting tabs.

- Simplified background painting. Now, instead of futzing with opacity and painting the background multiple times, we can just get the color for our current state and paint that color. This makes the GM3 changes we need very easy.

- Split background painting into two separate approaches for with and without images. I did have to keep the old approach in alongside the new one, just to handle themes with image backgrounds. It is, however, still greatly simplified.

- Consolidated state calculations into a new method, GetCurrentSelectionState, fixing some inconsistencies and correctly handling precedence of states over one another.

- Simplified opacity calculations, especially for hover. Rounding that .95 magic constant in GetThrobValue to 1* just let the math collapse down to a lerp.



*: Justification: code archaeology shows that .95 was just the result of faithfully carrying forward an arbitrarily picked value through a decade of refactors. Also it made an imperceptible visual difference - the exact value depends on the theme, but I believe it's at maximum a ~1% difference in absolute brightness.





Bug: 1399942

entry.title: graphite: Do not initialize WebGL CRP using Skia
entry.content:
Graphite won't support bottom left origin SkSurfaces or rendering.

WebGL context CanvasResourceProvider has the same origin as the context

which is bottom left most of the time (except when mesa framebuffer flip

extension is used). This CRP is initialized/cleared using Skia which

won't work with Graphite for bottom left origin, and is unnecessary

anyway since the WebGL context is responsible for rendering into it and

clearing it. The shared image clear rect tracking should enforce this.

entry.title: Don't disable ARC when ARC app gets pinned in XDG mode
entry.content:
Currently when non-ARC apps get pinned, ARC gets disabled. The

implementation assumes that SetUpEnvironmentForLockedFullscreen()

won't be called when an ARC window gets pinned, which is not the

case once ARC switches to XDG-based windows.



This CL adds an explicit check to

SetUpEnvironmentForLockedFullscreen() so ARC will only get

disabled when non-ARC windows get pinned.



Bug=b:287903215

Test=CTS doesn't crash.

entry.title: CrOS GMC V2: Allow multiple receivers/observers for CastMediaController
entry.content:
The CrOS updated Zenith media view needs to show the cast media item on

multiple UIs in the quick settings view, which requires all of them to

be able to receive media updates and send media action commands. This

needs us to turn CastMediaController to allow multiple

receivers/observers rather than deleting the old one upon new request

similar to MirroringActivity::CreateMediaController().

entry.title: The signal handler observes all necessary histogram with type
entry.content:
If the same histogram is used as enum and value, then the handler only

stores value and not enum. This affects the aggregates depending on

when a new models with the value type was added. Make sure the handler

stores the histogram with all the necessary types.

entry.title: gpu: win: Avoid unconditionally QI to IDCompositionVisual3
entry.content:
In crrev.com/c/4599273 we change DCLayerTree to use

IDCompositionVisual3 instead of IDCompositionVisual2. Since

IDCompositionDevice3 doesn't have a

CreateVisual(IDCompositionVisual3**) overload, we need to call

CreateVisual(IDCompositionVisual2**) and QueryInterface to

IDCompositionVisual3. This should be valid as long as a

IDCompositionDevice3 was used to create the visual.



However, we noticed crashes on our QI call, so this change moves the

cast to be optional only when the opacity property on a overlay is

non-default. This will not happen until delegated compositing is

enabled.



Bug: 1455666

Change-Id: Ib76e40d3d8526a5936bb1dbacf58763b79db174d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4626863

Commit-Queue: Michael Tang

Reviewed-by: Maggie Chen

Reviewed-by: Sunny Sachanandani

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1160933}

entry.title: [blinkpy] Pass/fail the expectations presubmit from linter status code
entry.content:
Searching the human-readable log for matching messages is brittle and

breaks if logs are added/reworded, as done in crrev.com/c/4623792.

`lint_test_expectations.py` already has distinct status codes conveying

the result in a machine-friendly way; use that instead.



Also:

* Move the wrapper around `lint_test_expectations.py` to

`blinkpy.presubmit` where other presubmits live.

* Raise the minimum severity for `lint_test_expectations.py` without

`--verbose` to avoid logging unnoteworthy events.



Bug: None

Test: Break `web_tests/TestExpectations` syntax.

Test: `git cl presubmit -v --force` shows the syntax error.

entry.title: Clear Bundle extra unclipped bounds in Android accessibility for web contents
entry.content:
This CL is a quick bug fix for the unclipped bounds extras that are

included in the AccessibilityNodeInfo objects for the web contents.



Before this CL we would include an unclipped top/bottom rect value for

downstream clients. We also cache AccessibilityNodeInfo objects, and in

the case of a scroll action, the only part of the AccessibilityNodeInfo

object that changes are the bounds. If a node is partially offscreen,

it will have an unclipped bottom value. If it is then scrolled onto

screen the unclipped bottom value should not be present, but if we are

still using the cached node, the unclipped bottom extra will still be

part of the node. This CL updates the implementation to clear the

cached extra values when updating location information.





AX-Relnotes: N/A

entry.title: [clang-plugin] Refactor: Abstraction of |CastingUnsafePredicate|
entry.content:
- Introduce generic recursive |TypePredicate|.

- This is abstraction of existing |CastingUnsafePredicate|.

- Re-implement |CastingUnsafePredicate| as a subclass of

|TypePredicate|.



Context:

I think we can have more compile-time check on TypeLoc, FieldDecl,

and VarDecl for better memory safety.

And performing DFS on |Type*| is likely to be shared operation across

these checks.

For now we have two predicates - |CastingUnsafePredicate| and

|StackAllocatedPredicate|. The first one is re-implemented in this CL.

The other will be re-implemented as a follow-up (needs flag-guarding).



Change-Id: I31f77f60a567f95e16042844509082030e7a335c

entry.title: Reland "Make sure OnPrintServersChanged listener is called after it is set."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 532ef3460607326a57be1ce2a951c80a8c88172b



The original CL had uninitialized raw_ptrs which were caught by MSAN. This reland fixes that by initializing them to nullptr.



Original change's description:

> Make sure OnPrintServersChanged listener is called after it is set.

>

> This fixes a bug where print servers from policies are not applied in

> managed guest sessions.

> By the time SetListener() is called, both device and user-level

> print servers are calculated and the OnServersChanged() observer is

> called, which does nothing if callback_ is not set by SetListener().

> OnServersChanged() is not going to get called again unless one of the

> print server policies change.

> This bug does not affect normal user sessions because user policies get

> fetched and processed after login.

>

> Bug: b/287922784

> Change-Id: If408e7bb9ddab4124d250a20205707752fd56061

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4628249

entry.title: Document and ensure that KURL specs only contain ASCII characters.
entry.content:
This was already the case but not clearly documented unless one read the

KURL implementation closely. The guards are introduced into places that

construct KURLs from strings or other types, but not into KURL copy

constructors/assignment operators (as the other constructor CHECKs

should ensure we never copy a KURL that would fail the newly-introduced

CHECKs).



Also clean up KURL's class-level comment to better reflect the state of

the world:

- The class-level comment previously seemed to encourage copying in one

paragraph, and then discourage it in the next.

- KURL is no longer actively thread hostile, since WTF::String is no

longer thread hostile.

entry.title: Always match onscreen GLSurface format with offscreen
entry.content:
To use virtualized contexts it's required and clients currently try to

make sure logic of picking format matches between client[1][2] and

service[3].



There is some discrepancy between definition of low-end there. To

simplify this logic, just set format on the service side.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/compositor_impl_android.cc;l=124-142;drc=51e1b713f6da38219910bf8fb93a81262340bf97;bpv=1;bpt=1

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/gl/gl_surface_egl.cc;drc=d14e19165d30af68c018ae8910c81cb3715dad93;l=1023-1030

entry.content:
When converting times in one second precision this is handy to

ensure you only indicate you are at second X + 1 when you are actually

at or past second X + 1, not partway between second X and X + 1.

entry.title: Stop using exploding time.
entry.content:
Exploding time from base::Time has issues with going through

the operating system time routines which can be limited in ways

like the Windows epoch, or the size of a time_t on 32 bit systems.



This changes them to convert via BoringSSL's POSIX time conversions

which do not have these limitations or OS dependencies and can

represent the entire valid range of generalized times for X.509.



Bug: 1455430

entry.title: add CHECK to make sure the VaapiVDA path is never taken
entry.content:
Now that we have completed the migration to the new VaapiVideoDecoder

and the legacy VaapiVideoDecodeAccelerator has been removed (see

CL:4585782), we should make sure that path is never inadvertently taken.

If the switch kUseChromeOSDirectVideoDecoder is disabled then the legacy

VDA path will be forced. Currently, this only happen for ChromeOS on

MediaTek 8173 (hana/elm/oak devices). These devices don't use VA-API so

they will never use the VaapiVideoDecodeAccelerator.



This CL adds a CHECK to enforce that the kUseChromeOSDirectVideoDecoder

switch is never enabled when using VA-API.

entry.title: Floatify printing code and APIs.
entry.content:
We were passing offsets and sizes as integers. Use floats instead. In

some parts of the code, sizes and offsets are in CSS pixels, in other

parts they are in device pixels, and in some other parts they are in

points. There are reasons for this, although it's currently a bit more

convoluted than it has to be.



Converting between them was done carefully with integer arithmetic and

some special rounding code. This has worked mostly fine, but is fragile.

I'm working on a CL that straightens out the conversions, to use CSS

pixels instead of points in the Blink APIs (since that's what Blink uses

internally). This would however mean that, if we were to keep on using

integers, rounding errors that used to occur when printing HTML with

Blink would be fixed, but, at the same time, we'd introduce new rounding

errors when printing with a plug-in (when opening a PDF and printing

it), since that part of the code wants things in points.



So use floats to avoid this. This also allows for removal of

PrintParamsWithFloatingSize. Although floats have precision issues for

large integer values, this shouldn't be a problem here, since all the

values changed are about page sizes, or offsets into a page (margins,

unprintable area, etc.). Floats have 23 bits for the integer part, so

as long as we stay (way) below a million pixels / points / whatever,

we're good. It would easily become a problem if we start using floats

for offsets into documents, though, as documents can become very tall.



This CL isn't expected to make much of a behavior difference on its

own. We'll still round down sizes to the nearest integer when entering

Blink HTML layout, since we cannot reliably print fractional page sizes

anyway. Furthermore, the way LocalFrame::ResizePageRectsKeepingRatio()

is used to magically convert from points to pixels is inaccurate, and

still causes the symptoms described in crbug.com/1444579



But it should now be more straight-forward to fix such issues without

introducing new ones.



Change-Id: I5fc5afeb14e5470faf970c9f7c94d0fad243ce3d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4604506

Reviewed-by: danakj

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1160870}

entry.title: Android: Add ResettersForTesting.register() to //base
entry.content:
Used Android Studio's "Structured Replace" to add it to all

setForTesting methods that contained a single assignment. Then

went through all spots to reset to "null/false" vs |oldValue|.



Removed calls to modified set*ForTesting(null/false) methods using

grep/sed/python then removed empty @After methods.



* Also cleans up some calls that had both @VisibleForTesting and

ForTest suffix (annotation is incorrect in this case).

* Also renamed a few test-only variables to have "ForTesting" suffix.



Updated tests that broke as a result. Things that broke:

* When setForTesting() was being called in @BeforeClass

* When a value was set as a result of normal logic, and then

setForTesting(null) was called to reset it (which then returned it to

it's non-null value).

entry.content:

and in QUIC (Google QUIC has been disabled altogether a long time ago,

and IETF QUIC never supported server push), so all removed code is

unused.

entry.title: win: Don't create PWA shortcuts in taskbar dir
entry.content:
CreatePlatformShortcuts was creating a shortcut in the taskbar

directory, and also pinning, when supported. Pinning a shortcut to the

taskbar does this implicitly, so we should not be doing this. For

tests, this is mostly harmless, since the quick launch dir is

overridden. For Chrome, it's potentially harmful.



The CL makes sure that in_quick_launch_bar is false, in the

ShortcutLocations CreatePlatformShortcuts passes to GetShortcutPaths.



This was discovered while trying to make sure that tests don't pin

shortcuts to the taskbar.

entry.title: [webauthn] Synced GPM passkeys on conditional UI
entry.content:
Display synced GPM passkeys on webauthn's conditional UI. Credentials

are shown for users who have opted in to syncing them. Credentials may

also show up on the platform authenticator credential picker. This is

okay as we'll update that UI surface before launching the feature.



For now, credentials are rendered with the subtext "Use lock screen". A

follow-up will change this to display the device name.



Tapping a GPM passkey dispatches to a sync paired phone. At the moment,

this is the first applicable phone on the list. A follow-up will have

Chrome remember the last used phone instead.



Finally, with the feature enabled IsConditionalMediationAvailable will

always return true on all desktop platforms since they are all capable

of showing GPM passkeys.



This feature is guarded by the WebAuthenticationListSyncedPasskeys flag

and requires SyncWebauthnCredentials to be enabled as well.



Bug: 1428655

entry.title: Move ColorProviderKey into its own header and make aliases
entry.content:
There are too many callers to migrate all at once, creating alises

in ColorProviderManager to facilitate the migration.



Many includes of color_provider_manager.h just need one of the types and

not the manager itself. Separate the Key types and declaration into its

own compilation units.



This allows targets to set ColorProviderKey values without depending

on the entirety of ui/color.

entry.title: Implement the from-font value for font-size-adjust
entry.content:
The 'from-font' value is newly added to CSS Font Module Level 5 [1],

which allows the browser to automatically determine a font-size-adjust

value based on the primary font. This change implements it.



[1] https://www.w3.org/TR/css-fonts-5/#valdef-font-size-adjust-from-font



We tweak font-size-adjust-013.html to make Windows happy. The platform

got a one-pixel mismatch of width and height due to subpixel rendering.



Test:

external/wpt/css/css-fonts/font-size-adjust-013.html

external/wpt/css/css-fonts/parsing/font-size-adjust-computed.html

external/wpt/css/css-fonts/parsing/font-size-adjust-valid.html



Bug: 1219875

entry.title: Fix Netflix not going fullscreen on some monitors.
entry.content:
AdjustTargetForFullScreenLetterboxing does not handle the case where the swap chain is larger than the screen size, this change detects that case and disables the optimization.



In this case overlay_onscreen_rect is 1920x1080,

swap_chain_size 1920x1080 and monitor size is 1366 x 768.

clipped_onscreen_rect is 1365 x 768.

entry.title: Reland "[text-fragment] Attempt search for dynamic content"
entry.content:
Reland note: iframes.sub.html was timing out because it contains several

sub-tests, each of which now wait 2s which, in total, exhausted the 6s

timeout. Reland marks this test as timeout=long to use the extended

timeout. Previously landed CL is first patchset.



Text fragments currently perform up to two searches, one when document

parsing completes and a second attempt when document load completes (if

load wasn't completed at parse complete time). However, pages, often

load content after document load, when content is "dynamically loaded".

One popular example is Mobile Wikipedia, which adds `hidden=until-found`

on collapsed sections in idle tasks after load. This meant

text-fragments couldn't target pages like these.



This CL attempts to make text fragments work on dynamically loaded pages

by performing a third attempt, if needed. If all directives haven't

matched at load time, a delayed task is scheduled for 500ms that will

request attachment on unmatched directives. TextFragmentAnchor listens

for relevant changes in the DOM and reschedules this task each time a

change is made. At 3000ms it gives up and performs the search to avoid

waiting forever.



At a high level, this CL tries to separate the state tracking of actions

performed for the first matching directive from the state tracking for

running multiple searches. This is done by introducing a new iteration_

enum tracking the latter.



Bug: 963045

entry.title: [Extensions] Update schemas to the new returns async format
entry.content:
This CL updates the following schemas to update them to the new format

for defining asynchronous returns.

- serial

- hid (sans receive, which has a multi-param callback)

- browser

- app.window

- fileSystem (sans chooseEntry, which has a multi-param callback, and

restoreEntry, which has a setUpdateArgumentsPostValidate hook that

can call the callback early)

- syncFileSystem



Note: These are mostly deprecated and restricted APIs, but are being

modified for consistency.

entry.title: Skip test_env_unittest and xvfb_unittest in PRESUBMIT
entry.content:
These two unittests were added to 3 CQ builders in

https://crrev.com/c/4515018 as swarmed script tests. That was done to

allow us to stop them being invoked via PRESUBMIT, since the tests

took ~10s. That can be a long time if you're making a simple

//testing/buildbot/ change.



So this finally moves them out of PRESUBMIT invocations. This means

upload times for testing changes should be faster. But a change that

regresses the test will only see the test regression in the CQ

rather than local presubmits. We assume this trade-off is worth it.



See how the CQ failed in https://crrev.com/c/4632504 where a test

failure was introduced.



Bug: None

entry.title: Fix focus test on Lacros.
entry.content:
Fixes FolderUploadConfirmationViewTest.InitiallyFocusesCancel on Lacros

by checking the stored focus view instead of the focused view. On

Lacros browser_tests, the containing window doesn't have focus so the

focus manager will report no view has focus. Checking the stored focus

will use the current focused view if there is one, and tell us the view

that will get focus when it returns which is what this test needs.

entry.title: Add WPT for closed AudioContext
entry.content:
Calling either of close, resume, or suspend on an already closed AudioContext

should reject the promise and throw an InvalidStateError.



spec: www.w3.org/TR/webaudio/#dom-baseaudiocontext-control-thread-state-slot

entry.title: Add an ExecutionContext to ScriptState
entry.content:
Most ScriptStates are associated with an ExecutionContext. This adds

a derived class, ScriptStateImpl, that inherits from ScriptState and

adds an ExecutionContext to it.



This allows direct ScriptState->ExecutionContext lookups, where

before it was ScriptState->v8::Context->global v8::Object->ScriptWrappable->derived type of ScriptWrappable->upcast to ExecutionContext.
